description:
Cup with trophy heads; polychrome earthenware; Peru, Nazca, VIc.; No Dims on Cat. Cards
Cup with slightly flaring mouth painted in polychrome with four rows of trophy heads.
text: This high-quality pot shows a series of four trophy heads repeated in bands around the exterior. Trophy heads were an integral part of the Nasca religion and militarism. The decapitated heads of warriors are thought to have played a role in enriching the land and community life in the hostile Nasca plains. Archaeologists have found more trophy heads in the Nasca region than in any other part of the world.
title: Vessel
